page.title: 01Kielder Village & environs
page.content: At the north end of Kielder Water, and at the heart of the Kielder Forest is the village from which both take their name. The forest surrounds the village,with only the valley of the Deadwater Burn to the north, and the reservoir to the south, breaking the blanket of trees. The Forestry Commission is the major employer in the area, and the village was extended in the early 1950s to cope for the influx of forestry workers. The Commission has workshops and laboratories in the village, as well as a Visitors' Centre. Picnic sites and view points have been established to encourage tourist to visit and enjoy the area.
